data.title: 3d model animation plays in desktop and 1.9.5 HTML5/GWT, not 1.9.6 or snapshot HTML5/GWT
data.body:
Hi, I have a 3D Maya animation (converted to .g3dj) that plays in 1.9.5, but in 1.9.6 and 1.9.7 snapshot it plays in desktop but no longer loads or plays in HTML5/GWT.  A toy version of the correct behavior can be viewed at http://www2.cs.uidaho.edu/~jeffery/testfbx/ and shows a book. Animation plays when you press the space bar. I want to move up to current code but when I do, the result is black screen with refresh button but no libGDX loading bar.

Source code that demonstrates the problem is at http://www2.cs.uidaho.edu/~jeffery/testfbx.zip, that is a whole testfbx/ libGDX application directory hierarchy for easy completeness but it is a bit fat.

data.title: ClassCastException when initalising expansion file with AndroidFragmentApplication
data.body:
#### Issue details
Trying to configure LibGDX to use [Expansion files](https://developer.android.com/google/play/expansion-files.html) via [setAPKExpansion](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/9b8f20b2d0e96e53f0f2b98dc8f6131c810aae71/backends/gdx-backend-android/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/android/AndroidFiles.java#L127) when the application object inherits from [AndroidFragmentApplication](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/9b8f20b2d0e96e53f0f2b98dc8f6131c810aae71/backends/gdx-backend-android/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/android/AndroidFragmentApplication.java) results in a ClassCastException. The setAPKExpansion method assumes that the application object inherits from [AndroidApplication](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/9b8f20b2d0e96e53f0f2b98dc8f6131c810aae71/backends/gdx-backend-android/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/android/AndroidApplication.java). It seems like this could be fixed by changing setAPKExpansion to cast to [AndroidApplicationBase](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/9b8f20b2d0e96e53f0f2b98dc8f6131c810aae71/backends/gdx-backend-android/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/android/AndroidApplicationBase.java) instead.

#### Reproduction steps/code
Create a LibGDX Android app with an application class that inherits from AndroidFragmentApplication.
After calling initalizeForView in the fragment's onCreateView method, call files.setAPKExpansion()

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
LibGDX 1.9.6

#### Stacktrace
```java
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.mygame.MyFragment cannot be cast to com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidApplication
                                                                          at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidFiles.setAPKExpansion(AndroidFiles.java:129)
                                                                          at com.mygame.MyFragment.onCreateView(MyFragment.kt:32)
                                                                          at android.support.v4.app.Fragment.performCreateView(Fragment.java:2248)
                                                                          ...
```

#### Please select the affected platforms
- Android

data.title: Fixed typo "inifite" -> "infinite"
No way to create exclusive fullscreen window using LWJGL3 backend
data.body:
#### Issue details
Using the LWJGL2 backend, the default behavior for setting a window to fullscreen was to make the window "exclusive fullscreen." When in exclusive fullscreen mode, a window catches the mouse and typically gives better performance.
In the LWJGL3 backend, the default behavior has changed. Making a window fullscreen now causes it to go into "borderless fullscreen." In borderless fullscreen mode, the mouse is not caught and the game typically performs worse than exclusive fullscreen. To my knowledge, there is no way to set an exclusive fullscreen display mode through the libGDX API- any attempt to set a fullscreen mode will only result in a borderless fullscreen window.

Why does this matter? In my case I'm able to run my game smoothly, but recording gameplay footage in fullscreen slows down the game significantly, while the LWJGL2 backend had no issues. Based on this, I imagine that users with worse hardware might have issues running the game smoothly in a borderless fullscreen window.

#### Reproduction steps/code
Simply make any game using the LWJGL3 backend fullscreen, using either the Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration or `Gdx.graphics.setFullscreenMode(mode)`. If you have multiple monitors, you can tell if the window is exclusive fullscreen based on whether or not it catches the mouse by default.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.6, LWJGL3 backend. This issue has been present since the introduction of the LWJGL3 backend.

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [X] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

I'm unsure if the same results are produced on Linux and Mac.

data.title: Little to no sound on iOS devices via internal speakers
data.body:
#### Issue details
Sound is low/virtually non-existent on iOS devices if using internal speakers. When hooked up to headphones or external speakers, there is no problem. Tested on iPhone 5S and iPhone 6S.

#### Reproduction steps/code
Case A:

Follow the instructions at https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Sound-effects. Use any sound file. Run on iOS using RoboVM and confirm that there is no sound.

Case B:

Test on iOS with RoboVM the project at https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx-demo-superjumper. Confirm that there is no sound.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
(Tested to not work)
1.9.6, RoboVM 2.3.0
1.9.4, RoboVM 2.2.0

#### Stacktrace
N/A

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] iOS (robovm)

data.title: Added "Use Kotlin" option for setup tool
data.body:
Supporting the new languages was primarily implemented through using a new Language enum containing the language-specific Gradle-related strings for the two supported languages (Java and Kotlin). Could be extended in the future to include other languages like Scala or Clojure.

I also edited the project build.gradle templates to be agnostic as to what language plugin they use.

This is feature that I personally felt I wanted to have, as tweaking new projects to compile Kotlin properly took a lot of time.

data.title: Clean up Android setup files
data.body:
The more recent Android tools plugin 2.2.0 is now necessary for instant run.

Also, I tweaked a few things to make it more like a default Android project. I think it's best to keep it as similar to a default Android project that Android Studio would create, so it's easier to follow along with tutorials and what not for the non-LibGDX stuff.

- `proguard-project.txt` is now called `proguard-rules.pro`.
- `versionCode` and `versionName` are specified in `build.gradle` instead of the manifest.
- A default release buildType is available such that proguard can be enabled simply by switching `minifyEnabled` to true. The `proguardFiles` line matches a default Android Studio project now.
- ` project.properties` is obsolete. The target is specified in the `build.gradle` file.

data.title: Mesh.java .copy() function tries to pass 'null' value to IndexBufferObject .setIndices() function when Mesh has zero indices.
Desktop project created by setup still uses lwjgl 2 causing problems for some xrandr configurations
data.body:
#### Issue details
Generating a new project with gdx-setup does not create a project that runs because of old lwjgl dependency. Symptoms for this may be error messages like:
```java
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
	at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglGraphics.setVSync(LwjglGraphics.java:558)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:124)
Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.XRandR.findPrimary(XRandR.java:326)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.XRandR.ScreentoDisplayMode(XRandR.java:315)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay$3.run(LinuxDisplay.java:746)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay$3.run(LinuxDisplay.java:743)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay.init(LinuxDisplay.java:743)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.Display.<clinit>(Display.java:138)
	... 2 more
AL lib: (EE) alc_cleanup: 1 device not closed

```
The reason seems to be bad parsing of `xrandr` output in lwjgl 2.9 which is better in lwjgl 3.0.

#### Reproduction steps/code

1. download [gdx-setup](https://bitly.com/1i3C7i3) as described in the [tutorial](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Project-Setup-Gradle)
2. execute it and create new project with only desktop backend selected
3. import project to IntelliJ
4. create Desktop run configuration as explained in the [video tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CXO0aT6rXTQ)
5. run this configuration

*Sidenote*: We figured that the parsing of the output of `xrandr` by lwjgl 2.9 failed because of an output (shortened here) like:
```
DP1 connected primary 1920x1200+1920+0 (normal left inverted right x axis y axis) 518mm x 324mm
   1920x1200_60.0  59.95*+
   1920x1200     59.95 +
   1920x1080     60.00    50.00    59.94    30.00    25.00    24.00    29.97    23.98  
   1920x1080i    60.00    50.00    59.94  
   1600x1200     60.00  
HDMI1 connected 1920x1200+0+0 (normal left inverted right x axis y axis) 518mm x 324mm
   1920x1200_60.0  59.95*+
   1920x1200     59.95 +
HDMI2 disconnected (normal left inverted right x axis y axis)
```

The display modes with underscore seem to be the problem.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
- gdxVersion = '1.9.6'
- gdx-backend-lwjgl

#### Stacktrace
```java
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
	at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglGraphics.setVSync(LwjglGraphics.java:558)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:124)
Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.XRandR.findPrimary(XRandR.java:326)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.XRandR.ScreentoDisplayMode(XRandR.java:315)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay$3.run(LinuxDisplay.java:746)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay$3.run(LinuxDisplay.java:743)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay.init(LinuxDisplay.java:743)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.Display.<clinit>(Display.java:138)
	... 2 more
AL lib: (EE) alc_cleanup: 1 device not closed
```

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

#### One possible solution

1. change `gdx-backend-lwjgl` to `gdx-backend-lwjgl3` in https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/9e4c560c66f4358cfd63381c9c35dca3e83a1e0d/extensions/gdx-setup/src/com/badlogic/gdx/setup/DependencyBank.java#L85
2. update the [DesktopLauncher template](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/9e4c560c66f4358cfd63381c9c35dca3e83a1e0d/extensions/gdx-setup/src/com/badlogic/gdx/setup/resources/desktop/src/DesktopLauncher) to use lwjgl3.

data.title: GLIBC 2.11 dependency
data.body:
Hello,


#### Issue details

I have been trying to install libgdx-based application distribution at a linux system. It seems that it requires glibc version 2.11 to be already installed at the target os... Question is, isn't this dependency supposed to come with libgdx natives, since if provide installer for my game, I cannot expect the user to already have this version of glibc, or to force him to install it.
In my case (and I suppose, in many other cases), the user might have his own considerations about what linux libraries he has in his system. Shouldn't libGDX natives jar contain the required dependencies? Or am I missing something.

In case that current state of things is forcing the user to install some specific version of glibc, where can I see the entire package dependencies tree for it? Unfortunately, my user does not have internet connection on his machine, so he cannot download it via package manager...

Thanks!

data.title: 1.9.6 GWT backend won't start in Firefox with Flash
data.body:
#### Issue details
HTML5 game compiled with libGDX 1.9.6 won't start in Firefox with Flash and remain blank on Windows 10. Firefox without Flash and Chrome don't have a problem.

The Javascript console logs the following output:

SoundManager V2.97a.20130512 (AS3/Flash 9) + HTML5 audio + preferFlash  soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
SoundManager 2 HTML5 support: mp3 = true (preferring flash), mp4 = true (preferring flash), ogg = true, opus = true, wav = true  soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
Error: Permission denied to access property "href"[Weitere Informationen]  (unbekannt)
Error: soundManager: Fatal: JavaScript file build "V2.97a.20130512" does not match Flash SWF build "V2.97a.20150601" at https://v6p9d9t4.ssl.hwcdn.net/html/495497/html/soundmanager2_flash9_debug.swf. Ensure both are up-to-date.  soundmanager2-jsmin.js:94:452
soundManager: No Flash response within expected time. Likely causes: Flash blocked or JS-Flash security error.  soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
soundManager.disable(): Shutting down  soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
SoundManager 2 failed to load (Flash security/load error)  soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357

Probable cause:  #4426 

#### Reproduction steps/code
Compile a HTML5 game and run it in Firefox with Flash enabled.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
libGDX 1.9.6
libGDX 1.9.4 worked fine.

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [X] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.body:
![screen shot 2017-05-28 at 12 42 38 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13012207/26751041/fc7342ba-484d-11e7-88e8-94ce07d9c714.png)

I have multiple screens in my game and each screen has its own Box2d world, whenever i try to switch my screen I face this error

       public void render(float delta) {
        update(Gdx.graphics.getDeltaTime());

        //Render
        Gdx.gl.glClearColor(0, 165, 114, 1);
        Gdx.gl.glClear(GL20.GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT);

        tmr.render();
        batch.begin();
        batch.draw(tex, frog.body.getPosition().x * PPM - getFrogWidth(w) / 3, frog.body.getPosition().y * PPM - getFrogHeight(w) / 3, getFrogWidth(w) * 0.8f, getFrogHeight(w) * 0.8f);
        for (Coin coin :
                coins) {
            if (!coin.isTouched())
                batch.draw(texCoin, coin.body.getPosition().x * PPM - 68, coin.body.getPosition().y * PPM - 68, 128, 128);
        }
        batch.end();

        //draw stage
        stage.act();
        stage.draw();

    }

####Upate Method

     public void update(float delta) {

        world.step(1 / 60f, 6, 2);
        cameraUpdate(delta);
        inputUpdate(delta);
        tmr.setView(camera);
        batch.setProjectionMatrix(camera.combined);
     
        if((mapPixelWidth - 200) <= frog.body.getPosition().x * PPM){
           game.gm.setPrefLevel(2);
            game.setScreen(game.levelLoading);  // error is faced when this code is executed
        }
    }

data.title: AndroidGraphics pause method may bug when the SurfaceView is detached from window
Controllers not working in GWT backend
data.body:
#### Issue details
Controllers are not working in GWT backend. getControllers returns an empty list. 
I have no problems with my game on Android and on Desktop.

* The sample space invaders does also not work with controllers in my browser. 
* http://html5gamepad.com/ works with all my gamepads and browsers. 
* [Gamescratch demo](http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2014/09/22/LibGDX-Tutorial-Part-14-Gamepad-support.aspx) also reports no connected controller.

#### Reproduction steps/code
Use gdx invaders demo. 

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.6 and GWT 2.8, also on 1.9.4 and GWT 2.6.1

#### Stacktrace
No stacktrace, but I suppose problem exists because gamepad support is not experimental in the browsers any more.

I debugged a bit and this method causes the problem:
`
	private static native JsArray<Gamepad> nativePollGamepads() /*-{
		return rawGamepads = (navigator.webkitGetGamepads && navigator.webkitGetGamepads()) || navigator.webkitGamepads;
	}-*/;
`

This must include calling the function without webkit prefix.
`return rawGamepads = navigator.getGamepads ? navigator.getGamepads() : ((navigator.webkitGetGamepads && navigator.webkitGetGamepads()) || navigator.webkitGamepads);`

Also, according to this [documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Gamepad_API/Using_the_Gamepad_API), the events "MozGamepadConnected" and "...disconnected" doesn't exist anymore, but "gamepadconnected" / "gamepaddisconnected".

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] HTML/GWT

data.title: Load color properties from tiled maps
data.body:
I implemented loading the color custom property from a tiled map file.

This fixes issues #4474 and #4756

I also tried to implement loading the file custom type but realized that it would be impossible without major refactoring or some hacky code.

private void requestData(String url) {

        httpRequest.setContent(null);
